summary:
I'm a UK born museum educator, trainer, facilitator and podcast host based in the Netherlands. 

I love teaching people the secrets of facilitating joyful experiences with art and objects. I enjoy sharing techniques to help everyone to engage and connect with museums, art, objects and ideas. 

I’m a huge fan of slow looking and have developed an approach to help people engage with art and objects in museums called Visible Thinking in the Museum (VTM). 

I work online and in-person with educators, guides, teachers and creatives to help them to confidently design and lead engaging inquiry-led programmes for any audience. 

I have my own podcast The Art Engager where I share a variety of easy-to-learn flexible techniques and tools to help create participant-centred, inquiry-driven experiences that bring art and objects to life. 

I believe art and museums are there for everyone. My mission is to share tools and techniques to help everyone to enjoy the world of art more fully, without necessarily needing recourse to any specialist, in-depth knowledge or skills.

I'm an ILM Level accredited coach (Level 5 in Effective Coaching and Mentoring) and have a Master of Museology from the Reinwardt Academy in Amsterdam. I am currently writing my first book about the VTM approach - out Autumn 2023!

Get in touch for training and workshop requests, speaking engagements. Find out more: 

https://thinkingmuseum.com/speaking/
https://thinkingmuseum.com/work-with-me/

treasury_media.title: Colour Shape Line Thinking Routine
treasury_media.description: COLOUR-SHAPE-LINE is a great thinking routine for making DETAILED OBSERVATIONS by focusing on the formal qualities of art.

treasury_media.title: Zoom In Thinking Routine
treasury_media.description:
'Zoom In' is a versatile thinking routine for: - Introducing and Exploring Ideas - Paying close attention to detail - Making inferences.
Zoom In fosters curiosity and engagement by the slow, gradual reveal of the image.

treasury_media.title: What is Visible Thinking in the Museum?
treasury_media.description: Find out what Visible Thinking in the Museum (VTM) is and the key benefits of working in this way.

projects.description:
Visible Thinking workshop at the international conference and launch of the 'Stories that Move' project.

Stories that Move was developed by a team of educators from seven countries and is now available in seven languages. 

Stories that Move aims to support educators by providing an inspiring tool that combines the special qualities of online and offline learning in a creative and engaging way.

The conference brought together 60 education experts from across Europe and from a variety of professional backgrounds.

profile_positions.description: Designing high quality private and custom tours in the Netherlands for small groups and families led by a team of hand-picked guides with extensive experience of teaching and guiding in museums. Our aim is to re-think the traditional guided tour: we want to engage visitors in conversation about people, places and history and the works of art or objects we are exploring together.
profile_positions.title: Private & Custom Tour Provider

profile_positions.description:
Designing and leading team-building workshops for professionals –  communications teams, project managers, medical practitioners, engineers and many more – to sharpen skills of observation, interpretation and reasoning; to improve listening skills; and to develop critical thinking skills using artworks and museum objects as a focus.

We design customised museum programmes for companies to compliment your organisational goals and objectives. Rather than dispensing information about art history, our professional facilitators enable lively, engaging conversations around a selection of artworks and give participants the opportunity to have in-depth discussions and exchange creative ideas.
profile_positions.title: Team-Building Workshop Provider

profile_positions.description:
As Head of Guide Community and Learning at Context Travel, I am responsible for the learning and community needs of a network of 1500+ guides worldwide. Context Travel offers cultural and historical tours and activities led by deep subject-matter experts in over 50 cities around the world. 

Working closely with our regional Program Managers, I identify and develop training and learning materials for Context's expert guides worldwide. This involves:

- Creating action/coaching plans for individual expert guides based on client feedback
- Designing a variety of annual and ongoing in-person training solutions - in-person events, 1-on-1 and 1-on-many events.
- Introducing blended approaches to learning such as coaching, remote training, and e-learning. 
- Creation of video and webinar content for training purposes
- Developing a specific training program for our family guides

I’m also responsible for establishing processes for enhancing the recruitment and on-boarding and evaluation of our guide network worldwide.

I’m working hard to build a global expert guide community at Context to share best practices, skills and make connections. This involves creating monthly subject-specific newsletters, maintaining and improving Context Learning (our social network and learning resource library for our expert community) and maintaining regular face-to-face contact with our community. I believe that we can be the ‘connector’ and create opportunities for our freelance guide network to make connections and learn from one another.
profile_positions.title: Head of Guide Community and Learning
